channel.title: Swift on Jonathan Hdez
channel.description: Recent content in Swift on Jonathan Hdez

item.title: Using Objective-C libraries in Swift
item.description: In this post I’m going to write how you can use Objective-c libraries in your Swift project. Xcode projects can contain either language, you can use this feature called Mix and Match to implement the latest swift features in your existing Objective-C proyect, or use objective-c code in new swift apps. For this example, I’m going to import ProgressHUD library, a lightweight and easy-to-use HUD for iOS. (Objective-C) 1. Clone or Download ProgressHUD from Github.
